   National Republican Congressional Committee
   stated on May 28, 2013 in a billboard:
   U.S. Rep. John Barrow’s plan "puts the IRS in charge of your health care."

"Congressman Barrow’s Plan: Put the IRS in charge of your health care,"
   the ad says.

Third, and most pertinent to the NRCC’s claim, Barrow voted against
   legislation in April 2011 that would fund as many as 16,500 IRS employees
   House Republicans said were needed to implement the health care law.

To sum up, the NRCC says in its mobile billboard that Barrow’s health care
   plan "puts the IRS in charge of your health care."
